alert.note: Alert for Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 15 at 12:47AM EDT until further notice by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following county, Wake. * WHEN...Until 345 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1243 AM EDT, Automated rain gauges along Crabtree Creek near Morrisville indicated continued rises due to heavy rain from runoff of heavy rain from late Friday evening. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Cary, Morrisville and William B Umstead State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
